newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Silver Eagle surges on change in control.
newsitem.headline: Silver Eagle surges on change in control.

text.p: Shares of consumer products maker and distributor Silver Eagle Holdings Ltd surged on asset injection hopes and better earnings prospects following a change in its controlling shareholder, brokers said on Monday.

"Hopes of possible injection of assets by the new controlling shareholder and anticipation of better earnings following the change in control fuelled short-term demand for the stock," a sales manager at a regional brokerage said.
Silver Eagle shares were up HK$1.14 or 64.77 percent to HK$2.90 in mid-morning after hitting a high of HK$3.10. Volume was 4.94 million shares worth HK$14.12 million.
Brokers said they expected profit-taking to put pressure the share price when buying orders retreating later.

Kwan Wing Holdings Ltd said earlier it had made a cash offer of HK$1.76 per ordinary Silver Eagle share and HK$4.51 per preference share on conversion of part if its preference share rights into a 66.42 percent stake in Silver Eagle.
